author: Staff Reporter
text:
S. Anantha Chandra Bose, Chairman, V.O. Chidambaranar Port Trust, flags off a 'Swachh Bharat' awareness mini-marathon near Tuticorin Old Port on Beach Road on Sunday.

Several people participated in a ‘Swachh Bharat – Clean India Mission’ awareness mini-marathon, which was organised by V.O. Chidambaranar Port Trust here on Sunday.

S. Anantha Chandra Bose, Chairman, V.O. C. Port Trust, flagged off the marathon race, which commenced from Old Port here on Beach road, and ended at the Port School grounds. The race was organised in four categories for boys, men, women and media personnel. Around 1,000 men, 800 boys and 100 women and 20 media personnel participated in an exclusive special race.

According to a statement, in men’s category, A. Mano from Alwarthirunagari, won the first prize after covering the distance of 10 km. He received a cash award of Rs.10,000 from Mr. Bose.

In women’s category, P. Muthumari from Tirunelveli bagged the first prize after running up to a distance of 7 km. She also received a cash award of Rs.10,000. In boys’ category, N. Murugan got the first prize after running up to 7 km and received cash prize of Rs.5,000. As for media personnel category, S. Chinnarajan secured the first prize and received cash of Rs. 3000.

Apart from cash awards, certificates and saplings were also given away to the first 25 finishers in all the three categories at the valedictory function. The prize distribution ceremony was held on the Port School grounds.

S. Natarajan, Deputy Chairman of the Port Trust, Port Trustees, including C. Subramanian, K. Pon Venkatesh and J. Senthil Kumar, and R. Ramakrishanan, officers and employees of various departments of the port were present.
title: ‘Swachh Bharat’ awareness marathon held in Tuticorin
